cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move northwest across the north-west Caribbean, cross the northern Yucatan Peninsula Monday night, then track north-northwestward through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast of the United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near Buras/New Orleans area)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in the United States at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in the United States at this time (Hurricane Warning only for Yucatan, Mexico)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: central Gulf Coast from southeast Texas through Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible at the port beginning late Wednesday with a 16% cumulative probability; brief higher gusts cannot be ruled out (4% chance of 50-kt winds).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of surge is possible along the lower Mississippi River delta; Baton Rouge is upriver, so direct surge will be muted but elevated river levels and back-water effects could disrupt terminal operations.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher totals could cause flash flooding and loading-yard drainage issues Wednesday into early Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Temporary closure of the Mississippi River to deep-draft traffic, possible barge breakaways, and power outages affecting cargo handling equipment.
